009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.Illuminant.D65;
013
014import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
015
016
017/**
018 * This class implements the CIELuv color space.
019 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
020 * coordinates, i.e., without chromatic adaptation to Java's D50-based profile 
021 * connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ 
022 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space.
023 * 
024 * @author W. Burger
025 * @version 2022/01/28
026 */
027@SuppressWarnings("serial")
028public class LuvColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
029                
030        // D65 reference white point:
031        private static final double Xref = D65.getX();  // 0.950456
032        private static final double Yref = D65.getY();  // 1.000000
033        private static final double Zref = D65.getZ();  // 1.088754
034        
035        private static final double uuref = fu(Xref, Yref, Zref); // u'_n
036        private static final double vvref = fv(Xref, Yref, Zref); // v'_n
037        
038        // chromatic adaptation objects:
039        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = new BradfordAdaptation(Illuminant.D65, Illuminant.D50);
040        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = new BradfordAdaptation(Illuminant.D50, Illuminant.D65);
041        
042        /**
043         * Constructor.
044         */
045        public LuvColorSpace() {
046                super(TYPE_Lab,3);
047        }
048        
049        // XYZ50->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D50)
050        /**
051         * {@inheritDoc}
052         * <p>
053         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) assumes that 
054         * the specified color coordinate is in D50-based XYZ space (with components in [0,1]).
055         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
056         * </p>
057         */
058        @Override
059        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
060                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
061                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
062        }
063        
064        // XYZ65->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D65)
065        /**
066         * Converts color points in D65-based XYZ space to CIELuv coordinates.
067         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])}.
068         * @param XYZ65 a color in D65-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
069         * @return the associated CIELuv color
070         */
071        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {    
072                double X = XYZ65[0];
073                double Y = XYZ65[1];    
074                double Z = XYZ65[2];
075                double YY = f1(Y / Yref);       // Y'
076                double uu = fu(X,Y,Z);          // u'
077                double vv = fv(X,Y,Z);          // v'
078                float L = (float)(116.0 * YY - 16.0);           //L*
079                float u = (float)(13 * L * (uu - uuref));       //u*
080                float v = (float)(13 * L * (vv - vvref));       //v*
081                return new float[] {L, u, v};
082        }
083        
084        // CIELab->XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Luv
085        /**
086         * {@inheritDoc}
087         * <p>
088         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) converts a
089         * CIELuv color to a color coordinate in D50-based XYZ space.
090         * See also {@link #toCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
091         * </p>
092         */
093        @Override
094        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Luv) {
095                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
096                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
097        }
098        
099        /**
100         * Converts the specified CIELuv color to D65-based XYZ coordinates.
101         * @param Luv CIELuv color
102         * @return the associated D65-based XYZ coordinates
103         */
104        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Luv) {
105                double L = Luv[0];
106                double u = Luv[1];
107                double v = Luv[2];
108                float Y = (float) (Yref * f2((L + 16) / 116.0));
109                double uu = (L < 0.00001) ? uuref : u / (13 * L) + uuref; // u'
110                double vv = (L < 0.00001) ? vvref : v / (13 * L) + vvref; // v'
111                float X = (float) (Y * ((9*uu)/(4*vv)));
112                float Z = (float) (Y * ((12 - 3 * uu - 20 * vv) / (4 * vv)));
113                float[] XYZ65 = new float[] {X, Y, Z};
114                return XYZ65;
115        }
116        
117        //sRGB->CIELuv
118        /**
119         * {@inheritDoc}
120         * <p>
121         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) converts a
122         * D65-based sRGB color coordinate assumed to the associated CIELuv color.
123         * </p>
124         */
125        @Override
126        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
127                float[] XYZ65 = new sRgb65ColorSpace().toCIEXYZ(srgb);
128                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
129        }
130        
131        //CIELuv->sRGB
132        /**
133         * {@inheritDoc}
134         * <p>
135         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) converts a
136         * CIELuv color to a D65-based sRGB color coordinate.
137         * </p>
138         */
139        @Override
140        public float[] toRGB(float[] Luv) {
141                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
142                float[] srgb = new sRgb65ColorSpace().fromCIEXYZ(XYZ65);
143                return srgb;
144        }
145        
146        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
147        
148        private static final double epsilon = 216.0/24389;
149        private static final double kappa = 841.0/108;
150        
151        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
152        private double f1 (double c) {
153                return (c > epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
154        }
155        
156        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
157        private double f2 (double c) {
158                final double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
159                return (c3 > epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / kappa;
160        }
161        
162        private static double fu (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
163                // fails if 0.001 is used!
164                return (X < 0.00001) ? 0 : (4 * X) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
165        }
166        
167        private static double fv (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
168                return (Y < 0.00001) ? 0 : (9 * Y) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
169        }
170
171}
